org.apache.taverna.server.master.notification

Class TwitterDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.server.master.notification.RateLimitedDispatcher
      • org.apache.taverna.server.master.notification.TwitterDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageDispatcher

    public class TwitterDispatcher
extends RateLimitedDispatcher
    Super simple-minded twitter dispatcher. You need to tell it your consumer key and secret as part of the connection parameters, for example via a dispatcher URN of "twitter:fred:bloggs" where fred is the key and bloggs is the secret.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TwitterDispatcher.NoCredentialsException
      Indicates that the user did not supply their credentials.
      static class  TwitterDispatcher.NotConfiguredException
      Indicates that the dispatcher has not been configured with service credentials.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of this dispatcher, which must match the protocol supported by it (for a non-universal dispatcher) and the name of the message generator used to produce the message.

      • setAccessToken

        public void setAccessToken(String token)

      • setAccessSecret

      • dispatch

        public void dispatch(String messageSubject,
                     String messageContent,
                     String targetParameter)
              throws Exception
        Description copied from class: RateLimitedDispatcher
        Dispatch a message to a recipient that doesn't care what produced it.
        Specified by:
        dispatch in class RateLimitedDispatcher
        Parameters:
        messageSubject - The subject of the message to send.
        messageContent - The plain-text content of the message to send.
        targetParameter - A description of where it is to go.
        Throws:
        Exception - If anything goes wrong.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Returns:
        Whether this message dispatcher is actually available (fully configured, etc.)
